result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Schweitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With huber.  Stayed until on or before February 2, 2017 between 6-7 a.m. No costs imposed for Counts 1 and 2 of this case, only Count 3 which is a probation count.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment (Time Served)

Status in 16CM129 and 17CM13.  Defendant John R. Schweitzer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to the disorderly conduct counts and criminal damage to property in 16CM129 and also to bail jumping in 17CM13.  Count 1 in 17CM13/disorderly conduct to be dismissed/read in.  

Def pleads no contest to counts 1, 2 and 3 in 16CM129 and to count 2 in 17CM13.  Court's colloquy on pleas.

Sentence:  45 days jail, concurrent, for counts 1 and 2 of 16CM129.  Count 3 of 16CM129 and count 2 of 17CM13:  2 years probation with AODA/follow through and m. health asst/follow through.  Costs - 1 set imposed in 16CM129, as a condition of probation.  Credit:  6 days in 16CM129 and 4 days in 17CM13.  Count 1 of 17CM13 DRI.  Huber.  Jail report:  on or before February 2, 2017 between 6-7 a.m.
Status conference on February 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

17CM13/initial and 16CM129/plea and sentencing.  Defendant John R. Schweitzer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  

Initial appearance completed in 17CM13.  Formal reading waived; NG entered.  Atty. McDougal asks for setover of both cases - working towards resolution.

Court sets 2/1 at 1:30 for status in both cases.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
